intro: Corymbium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy corymbium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in corymbs, a type of inflorescence. Corymbium hirtum is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
